title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page
OB: There is no listing of children nodes when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. In the data set editor, navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one.
4. Check that the new data source has no database/table/column information listed.

Observed result: There is no listing of children nodes when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.

To resolve the issue:
1. Close the data set editor.
2. Reopen the data set editor to check if the children node listing appears again.
